intro: Ohigginsia refulgens f. ortgiesii, commonly known as the Ortgies' goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grey-green leaves, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers. This ornamental plant is valued for its vibrant color and drought tolerance in landscaping.
